Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2008 10:35PM Sirena_Gorda wrote: Thanks to both of you for your replies.  No, they didn't throw out the slides; I went to the hospital to get them and personally delivered them to my new doctor when I had my first appointment.  Beesie's explanation that maybe there wasn't a large enough sample of the cancer makes sense.  The slides have been re-examined by the radiologist(s) at my new facility, and I definitely need another biopsy to get the info they need because I am not having surgery before chemo.  My doctor plans to do neoadjuvant therapy--shrinking the tumor with whatever chemo or hormones they decide to use after they get the additional info they need, like ER/PR + or -, etc.  Then they will do a lumpectomy.  I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that though.  I just want this stuff OUT of my body asap. Has anyone else out there had neoadjuvant therapy before a lumpectomy or mastectomy?
